panels.description:
The 3 CPU states
There are 3 general states your CPU can be in:

    Idle, which means it has nothing to do.
    Running a user space program, like a command shell, an email server, or a compiler.
    Running the kernel, servicing interrupts or managing resources.
panels.title: CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Used metric:
netdev_bytes_r - Number of bytes received.
panels.title: Average Rate Recived Data

panels.description:
Used metric:
netdev_bytes_s - Number of bytes sent
panels.title: Average Rate Sent Data

panels.description: netdev_drops_r - Number of packets dropped while receiving
panels.title: Read drops

panels.description: netdev_drops_s;Pkts;Number of packets dropped while sending
panels.title: Send drops

panels.description:
Used metric:
port_xmit_data- Total number of data octets, which are divided by 4 (lanes), transmitted through all virtual lanes.
panels.title: IB Average Rate Transmitted Data

panels.description:
Used metric:
port_rcv_data	-Total number of data octets, which are divided by 4 (lanes), received on all virtual lanes. transmitted through all virtual lanes.
panels.title: IB Average Rate Received Data

panels.description: port_rcv_errors -Total number of packets containing an error that were received on the port.
panels.title: IB Number of received packets containing an error

panels.description: port_xmit_discards - Total number of outbound packets discarded by the port because the port is down or congested.
panels.title: IB Number of outbound packets discarded
